sn32:1.1.4_0: And what are the gods of the clouds?

sn32:53.0.1_0: The Linked Discourses on the going forth,
sn32:53.0.3_0: As the cool clouds are cold, they rimmed around.
sn32:53.1.3_0: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why sometimes it becomes cool?”
sn32:53.1.4_0: “Mendicant, there are what are called gods of the cool clouds.
sn32:53.1.6_0: ‘Why don’t we revel in our own kind of enjoyment?’ Then, in accordance with their wish, it becomes cool.
sn32:53.1.7_0: This is the cause, this is the reason why sometimes it becomes cool.”
sn32:54.0.1_0: The Linked Discourses on the going forth,
sn32:54.0.3_0: The rain clouds are hot clouds.
sn32:54.1.3_0: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why sometimes it becomes warm?”
sn32:54.1.4_0: “Mendicant, there are what are called gods of the warm clouds.
sn32:54.1.6_0: ‘Why don’t we revel in our own kind of enjoyment?’ Then, in accordance with their wish, it becomes warm.
sn32:54.1.7_0: This is the cause, this is the reason why sometimes it becomes warm.”
sn32:55.0.1_0: The Linked Discourses on the going forth,
sn32:55.0.3_0: The gods of the Thirty-Three did likewise.
sn32:55.1.3_0: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why sometimes it becomes stormy?”
sn32:55.1.4_0: “Mendicant, there are what are called gods of the storm clouds.
sn32:55.1.6_0: ‘Why don’t we revel in our own kind of enjoyment?’ Then, in accordance with their wish, it becomes stormy.
sn32:55.1.7_0: This is the cause, this is the reason why sometimes it becomes stormy.”

sn32:56.1.3_0: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why sometimes it becomes windy?”
sn32:56.1.4_0: “Mendicant, there are what are called gods of the windy clouds.
sn32:56.1.6_0: ‘Why don’t we revel in our own kind of enjoyment?’ Then, in accordance with their wish, it becomes windy.
sn32:56.1.7_0: This is the cause, this is the reason why sometimes it becomes windy.”
sn32:57.0.1_0: The Linked Discourses on the going forth,
sn32:57.0.3_0: Standing rain on the sky, the rain of clouds.
sn32:57.1.3_0: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why sometimes it rains?”
sn32:57.1.4_0: “Mendicant, there are what are called gods of the rainy clouds.
sn32:57.1.6_0: ‘Why don’t we revel in our own kind of enjoyment?’ Then, in accordance with their wish, it becomes rainy.
sn32:57.1.7_0: This is the cause, this is the reason why sometimes it rains.”
sn32:57.1.9_0: The seventh section on Wisdom is finished.
sn32:57.2.5_0: The Linked Discourses on gods of the clouds are complete.
